p: Starch as biopolymer is often used in pharmaceutical formulations due to its biodegradability and versatility [ 126, 127]. Modified starch had been also investigated for encapsulation of EOs in various forms, for example, spherical aggregates, nanoparticles, or porous compounds [ 128, 129, 130, 131]. In a recent investigation, the nanoencapsulation of clove essential oil in 3D nano-network porous starch-based material to enhance the antimicrobial activities of the matrix, it was pursued [ 132]. The study presented an elaborate preparation process that included starch gelatinization with subsequent complexation (and further remove) of the CaCO 3 template with 3D-nanoparticles formation for the clove EO encapsulation. The new nanoparticles containing EO presented enhanced and prolonged bacteriostatic effect. The schematic illustrative preparation of the nanoparticles was presented by the authors ( Figure 4).
